programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: When a witness in a murder trial flees out of fear of retaliation, Erin and Anthony must find him and convince him to testify; Garrett encourages Frank to attend the Police union party; Danny and Baez investigate a robbery at a convenience store.

programme.title: Blue Bloods

programme.desc: When Sebastian is injured while unsuccessfully trying to prevent a kidnapping, NCIS races to find the missing woman and her abductors; the team gets a peek into Agent Carter's personal life.

programme.title: Tropical Heat

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Spider's ex girlfriend shows up in Key Mariah, asking him to protect her from her abusive boyfriend. When the boyfriend is found dead, and stolen money comes into the picture, Spider turns to Nick for help.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The husband of a marine biologist is found dead at the institute where she works. Although she is the primary suspect in the case, her employer is convinced of her innocence and hires Nick and Sylvie to prove it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick's deadbeat con artist father is arrested for the murder and robbery of a local socialite. Nick, although quite jaded about his dad, decides to look into the matter.

programme.desc: Phil explores how to make things go using propulsion and inertia.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.title: All-Century Team

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Although this edition of the Fall Classic represented a rematch of the 1942 World Series, there were some familiar faces missing from both the Cardinals and Yankees due to World War II.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Although the Yankees had beaten the Dodgers in their five previous World Series matchups, Brooklyn gave notice in Game 1 of the 1955 World Series that it wouldn't be dismissed so easily and went the distance to take home their first championship title.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1960 matchup between the Pirates and the Yankees. Entering the bottom of the 9th inning of Game 7 tied at 9, Pirates second baseman Bill Mazeroski smashed a walk-off home run to crown the team as World Series champions

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The 1964 World Series Film highlights Bob Gibon's complete-game effort against the Yankees

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1965 matchup between the Dodgers and the Twins. With Los Angeles and Minnesota tied at 3 games apiece, Hall of Famer Sandy Koufax twirled a stellar three-hit shutout to lift the Dodgers to their 4th World Series title

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Oakland A's, in search of the franchise's first World Series Championship since 1930, outlasted Cincinnati's "Big Red Machine" in a seven game series that featured six contests that were decided by only one run.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1975 matchup between the Reds and the Red Sox. After trailing 3-0 in Game 7, Cincinnati battled back to take the lead in the 9th and capture their first World Series of the decade, giving birth to the "Big Red Machine"

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Bill Mazeroski hits a walk-off homer to win the World Series for the Pirates against the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: George Brett collects four RBIs against the Blue Jays in the Royals' 6-5 win in Game 3 of the ALCS.

programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: In the snowy landscape of Michigan's Northern Peninsula, Derek finds a 1964 Ford Galaxie that's sat abandoned for 32 years; he plans to not only get this Ford running, but also to turn it into a rally-tribute car.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys try their hand at no-prep drag racing against Lyle Barnett and his turbocharged 1,500-hp Beer Money Mustang.

programme.title: Speed Is the New Black
programme.desc: With new demands from their client, Classic Car Studios fights to finish their 1971 Chevelle reinvention from classic muscle to modern day super car.

programme.title: Runs Good
programme.desc: Dan and Shea drive out to Clovis, New Mexico, to buy the holy grail of JDM imports, a Toyota AE86; nostalgia aside, Aaron is skeptical whether it was a good buy, or even roadworthy.

programme.title: Head 2 Head
programme.desc: Iconic cars go against one another in a battle for bragging rights.

programme.title: Head 2 Head Drag Race
programme.desc: Jeff and Jonny can't decide which supertruck is best, or even what the definition of supertruck is; they debate whether it's about how it looks, sounds or drives, horsepower/torque, whether it can be electric, and whether it can even do truck things.

programme.title: Super Turbo Story Time
programme.desc: Some cars carry powerful myths with them long after they are gone; these are stories of cars whose intriguing legends have endured long past the metal they are made from.

programme.title: Super Turbo Story Time
programme.desc: The quest for speed has been ingrained in humans since the birth of the wheel; these are stories of people who gathered like-minded speed freaks and created outlaw cultures of pushing the limits of public roads.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: All American Classics, a popular salvage yard in Vancouver, Wash., has been forced to downsize due to city expansion and rising taxes; that doesn't stop Steve Magnante from finding what he's looking for in this classic auto salvage yard.

programme.title: Roadkill's Junkyard Gold
programme.desc: In Denton, Texas, Steve Magnate ends up hooking an AMC Marlin, finding a factory-built V-8 Vega, digging around in an ex-law enforcement Plymouth sedan the Blues Brothers would love and uncovering a super-rare, dual-quad four-door Buick.

programme.title: Shorty's Dream Shop
programme.desc: Paul decides to take one of his prized 1959s and go full lowrider with hydraulics and a full custom lowrider paint job; Shorty's wife Lupe has a 1992 Mustang GT 5.0, and Shorty has a honey do list to get this car back to its original glory.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Discovering how a wet system stacks up against a dry system in an EFI manifold.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Multipoint EFI gets its turn against the venerable Dominator; it's injectors versus jets, dry flow versus wet, and drivability versus horsepower.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek enlists Steve Dulcich to help put the muscle back into a derelict Dodge Coronet. But with a completely seized drivetrain, the guys will have to replace everything on this car if they hope to make the 500-mile road trip back to Nashville.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys take on off-road Baja legend Cameron Steele on a brutal desert off-road course with a Baja Bug; they may be outmatched by Cameron's unlimited racing rig, but the addition of a 350 V-8 to their Bug closes a big gap.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The ability to run a blend of gas and E85 is a game changer; credit the flex fuel sensor, which samples fuel composition and adjusts fuel flow, making more power as more E85 is mixed in.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Do boost leaks really even matter? Can vacuum leaks make more power? You read those questions right. Come be surprised right along with us as we find power in unexpected places, and lose less than we'd expect in others.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides

programme.desc: A 1971 Suburban returns to the shop for "phase two," wanting more power and custom metalwork; when a client finds parts and pieces of a '68 C10, Bill and the crew set on a new course for a ground-up build.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The only mixed game event of the 2021 Poker Masters sees Maxx Coleman as the chip leader of the 8-Game. Chad Eveslage and Jeremy Ausmus sit at their second final table, while Erik Sagstrom and Stephen Chidwick are also in contention for the $120,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The stakes have been raised in Event #8, and Lou Garza holds the chip lead over the final five players. Chris Brewer, Darren Elias, Brock Wilson, and John Riordan all look to dethrone Garza as $427,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #8: $25,000 Pot-Limit Omaha final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! John Riordan is the chip leader ahead of Alex Livingston, Sean Winter, Tony Bloom, Matthew Wantman, and Sam Soverel, as the final six play for the $360,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #9: $25,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Justin Bonomo is the chip leader ahead of Seth Davies, Sean Winter, Jason Koon, Brian Rast, and Nick Schulman, as the final six play for the $432,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Dolly's Game

programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: A massive $680,000 first-place prize awaits the winner in Event #11 as Australian Michael Addamo holds the chip lead. Trailing Addamo are Jason Koon, David Coleman, Cary Katz, and Alex Foxen who are all looking to grab their first Poker Masters title of the year.

He joins aboard the Southern Belle, owned by a fiery redhead, which ends up being the latest victim in a suspicious string of wrecks. Yancy finds a connection between the murder of Charlie Webster and a dispatch key belonging to a ship pilot.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy traces a group of beautiful blonde crooks to an old mansion where he learns that the pair were targeting pickpockets, crooked gamblers and thieves to pay for a half-dozen orphans that Elsie Tulliver had adopted. Yancy arranges for photographer Mathew Brady and pickpocket Jody Barker to help him with a scheme to raise money for Elsie's children.

programme.desc: When a Chinese-American is accused of murder, the Cartwrights protect him from a manipulative mayoral candidate who wants all "foreigners" to leave.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners

Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan kick things off with their starters. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contenders Johnnie Mountain and Aiden Byrne along with newcomer Simon Rogan present their respective fish courses. programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Join me for an exclusive interview with Coach HP as we embark on an incredible journey with a true sports aficionado. Born in Cuba and driven by an unwavering passion for baseball, Coach HP's life story is a remarkable odyssey from Miami to Los Angeles and beyond.Growing up under the guidance of a strict yet devoted father, he imbibed the value of hard work, a cornerstone of his extraordinary success today. After his baseball days in high school and college, Coach HP headed to the West Coast, where he explored a world beyond the diamond.His path is marked by intriguing twists, including influential roles in entertainment and nightlife, as well as becoming a sought-after national speaker. Yet, at the core of it all, baseball has been his heart's true calling. In 2016, Coach HP returned to Miami with a fresh training approach that's revolutionizing the game. Join us for this enlightening conversation where we not only uncover the lessons learned in baseball but also gain insights into life's profound journey. It's a story of passion, hard work, and the relentless pursuit of excellence that you won't want to missPrepare to be inspired, entertained, and motivated. programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he‚Äôs not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we‚Äôve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you‚Äôre traveling the world or ‚Äúembracing the suck‚Äù with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear‚Äôs up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‚Ä™@ben_moon‚Ä¨ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we‚Äôll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they‚Äôve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen‚Äôs 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary‚Äôs ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin‚Äôs history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership‚Äîfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it‚Äôs almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn‚Äôt defined solely by what you wear ‚Äî it‚Äôs personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn‚Äôt end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we‚Äôll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they‚Äôve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas‚Äô own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin‚Äôs first suburb. It‚Äôs a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he‚Äôs not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Gear Lab

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: This episode of Huckberry Homes brings us out to the Western Slope, just a few miles outside of Vail, Colorado to visit our longtime friend and collaborator Sinuhe Xavier. programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Join me for an exclusive interview with Coach HP as we embark on an incredible journey with a true sports aficionado. Born in Cuba and driven by an unwavering passion for baseball, Coach HP's life story is a remarkable odyssey from Miami to Los Angeles and beyond.Growing up under the guidance of a strict yet devoted father, he imbibed the value of hard work, a cornerstone of his extraordinary success today. Yet, at the core of it all, baseball has been his heart's true calling. In 2016, Coach HP returned to Miami with a fresh training approach that's revolutionizing the game. Join us for this enlightening conversation where we not only uncover the lessons learned in baseball but also gain insights into life's profound journey. It's a story of passion, hard work, and the relentless pursuit of excellence that you won't want to missPrepare to be inspired, entertained, and motivated. Don't miss this exclusive interview with Coach HP; hit that 'Subscribe' button, turn on notifications, and join us on this extraordinary adventure. programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we traveled down to Jacksonville, Florida to meet up with longtime friend, GORUCK Co-founder, and former Special Forces Green Beret Jason McCarthy. When he‚Äôs not rucking to and from the GORUCK HQ, you can find him and his friends putting on grueling garage workouts that are the talk of the neighborhood. Huckberry and GORUCK go way back, we‚Äôve shared plenty of good times, GORUCK Challenges, and (more than) a few beers along the way. Their military-grade lineup is designed to be taken to hell and back in the field. So whether you‚Äôre traveling the world or ‚Äúembracing the suck‚Äù with a 30 LB plate in your rucksack, you can be sure your gear‚Äôs up to the challenge."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‚Ä™@ben_moon‚Ä¨ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we‚Äôll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they‚Äôve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen‚Äôs 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary‚Äôs ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin‚Äôs history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership‚Äîfeaturing the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it‚Äôs almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Our friend and host of DIRT, Josh Rosen, stopped by the Gear Lab to show us what he packed for our most recent DIRT episode in Alaska.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn‚Äôt defined solely by what you wear ‚Äî it‚Äôs personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn‚Äôt end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we‚Äôll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they‚Äôve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas‚Äô own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin‚Äôs first suburb. It‚Äôs a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we drove out the Texas Hill Country to see our good friend Cameron Duddy. When he‚Äôs not touring around the world with his band Midland, you can find him out on his ranch, deep in the heart of Texas. Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Gear Lab
programme.desc: Embracing passion. Devotion to craft. Never being in a rush. That‚Äôs the ethos of Ma√±ana, a surf and apparel company based right here in Austin, Texas. Our friend and Ma√±ana Founder Alec stopped by the Huckberry Gear Lab to show us some of the tools he uses everyday while hand shaping surfboards.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: This episode of Huckberry Homes brings us out to the Western Slope, just a few miles outside of Vail, Colorado to visit our longtime friend and collaborator Sinuhe Xavier. When he's not traveling the world shooting commercials and making short films, Xavier's at home in his quiet, perfectly appointed retreat deep in the Rockies here he's a three hour drive from Red Rock desert and a ten minute drive from some of the best snowboarding in the world. There was plenty of magic in Sinuhe's spot, from his BMW GS to his exploration of how his love for his son shaped the design and decoration of his pad.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh‚Äôs hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm‚Äîit‚Äôs all on the menu.

However, Paine isn't as noble as his reputation would indicate, and he becomes involved in a scheme to discredit Smith, who wants to build a boys' campsite where a more lucrative project could go. Determined to stand up against Paine and his corrupt peers, Smith takes his case to the Senate floor.

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Causton is buzzing at the opening of a new brewery on the site of a famously cursed Abbey. But excitement turns to fear when a man is found boiled to death in one of the vats. DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are puzzled; could this really be about beer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Mahesh Sidana - butterfly collector and founding member of an elite IQ society - is found murdered, pinned to a wall in a manner akin to his treasured butterfly specimens, DCI Barnaby and DS Winter are thrust into a crime that impacts not only on their community, but internationally. With the help of an old friend, can they catch the culprit before another victim is found...?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley‚Äôs comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances‚Ä¶ and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend‚Äôs wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Things take a gruesome turn when Ferrabees Circus comes to town, bringing with it a chain of sinister clown sightings, threatening notes and deathly dangerous circus acts. Barnaby will have to face up to his fears in order to solve the case

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for ¬£400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie takes Sadie on a tour of a local college in hopes of convincing her to stay nearby after her impending high school graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family throws a party for Willie & Korie's 25th anniversary, but things take a dramatic turn when Willie and Korie reveal a big secret. Meanwhile, when Jase blames Uncle Si for getting him a parking ticket.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie asks a local chainsaw artist to make him a statue, he gets a big surprise when it's revealed that the statue is of an unlikely subject -- Willie himself. Meanwhile, Jep and Jessica attempt to help Kay with her hoarding.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: On a trip to New York, Jase's son Reed proposes to his girlfriend, which inspires his father to fan the flames of romance back home with Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The tables are turned when the HOA comes to Jase for help to rid the neighborhood of a menacing beaver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Jep get into an argument over which of them is the rightful heir to their grandfather's old rifle, they decide to settle the argument with a marksmanship contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Si has started moonlighting as a grocery bagger, the guys show up at the store and their teasing inadvertently causes Si to lose his job and his chance to enter a local bagging competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a large storm hits Monroe, most of the adults head to Phil and Kay's to help protect their house from flooding while Jess, Sadie, Rebecca and Cole babysit the kids.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie accompanies Kay to a local bingo tournament and gets seduced by the game, eventually embarrassing himself and Kay with his enthusiasm.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertson brothers debate which of their wives makes the best cornbread, it escalates into a full-on cornbread cook off. Meanwhile, when Jep, Martin, and Godwin play a practical joke on Uncle Si.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys enjoy a one-day rodeo fantasy camp where they learn the ins and outs of riding, roping and clowning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After leaving school to pursue music, Jase feels that Reed needs some structure in his life, so he hires him to take his place at Duck Commander.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase accompanies Willie on a business trip to Arkansas to pitch a new product and has unorthodox sales strategies. Back in Monroe, Jep and Si have to track down an important item of Willie's that they accidentally shipped out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase run against each other to become president of their neighborhood HOA. Jep, Jess and Miss Kay work on a Duck Commander themed display for the local zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil, Willie and Ms. Kay attempt to produce a cooking video for their fans.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: As the season reaches the halfway point, drivers are desperate to pull ahead in the dash for the cash.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: In Alaska, the storm of the decade pounds the Dalton, sending the truckers' hauls into chaos.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Harsh winter weather has left Lisa stranded in Prudhoe Bay. Dave is in a convoy with Maya and Tony, he tests their patience before leaving them behind.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Hugh and Rick face an obstacle that has the ice road blocked, until Hugh decides to clear a path, while Alex gets too close for comfort with a parked car.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the first warm day of spring and the ice roads are getting dangerously slick. Hugh and Rick hauling tankers with diesel fuel, run into Alex at a fuel stop.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Dave Redmon is at odds--yet again--with his bosses, this time over making a rookie error, and Maya faces freezing brakeline issues as she dashes down the melting ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Lisa and Maya help a stranded driver get back on the road; Tony gets a surprise from Carlile; Dave continues his descent into isolation; Hugh and Rick keep up their load count with backhauls; Alex deals with unstable freight.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With the end of the ice road fast approaching, the Ice Road Truckers are sprinting to the finish. But they've got obstacles.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The finish line is in sight and the race heats up. In Canada, Hugh and Rick come across an obstacle that could help Alex take the lead over his old rival Hugh.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa's wedding is only three days away, but Dog is thinking about bounties, not bouquets. A hot jump has comes in and Dog wants to go on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel. But sometimes the defendant is a threat to the community and the cosigner asks the bondsman for protection.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team begin their day by judging the local elementary school's talent show, where they declare all the kids to be winners.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to sweep the island clean of as many fugitives as he can in two days. Raymond, wanted on drug charges, is an easy grab. Mauro, wanted for solicitation, is busted.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to liven things up with a competition. He and Beth will hunt for one fugitive, while Leland and Justin chase another.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog faces a tough personal and professional situation when he must hunt down his friend, Ili, who has helped him on many busts. But now Ili's on the other side of the law. She's didn't come to court to answer charges that

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team go after Kandice, AKA Candy, AKA Suga, a stripper who didn't make her court appearance. They convince one of her friends to lure her to a supermarket parking lot, where Dog has an easy time fetching the fetching young thing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Denver Dog discovers that recapturing the past can be more difficult then tracking down felons. On a day of more misses then hits in their fugitive hunting, Dog and Beth repeatedly collide with reminders of their early days.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is up in the high plains of Colorado helping a fellow bondman bring his most elusive fugitives to justice. When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has a big problem. Patty Estabilio has jumped a $15,000 bail bond and disappeared into Hawaii's underworld. Kissing the kids good night, Dog and Beth, with Tim and Leland at their side, plunge into a drug-infused netherworld.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog faces a tough personal and professional situation when he must hunt down his friend, Ili, who has helped him on many busts. But now Ili's on the other side of the law. She's didn't come to court to answer charges that

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team go after Kandice, AKA Candy, AKA Suga, a stripper who didn't make her court appearance. They convince one of her friends to lure her to a supermarket parking lot, where Dog has an easy time fetching the fetching young thing.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Back in Denver Dog discovers that recapturing the past can be more difficult then tracking down felons. On a day of more misses then hits in their fugitive hunting, Dog and Beth repeatedly collide with reminders of their early days.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog shows his love of justice and children in this poignant episode. He begins by giving encouragement to a group of handicapped children and making them honorary members of his posse.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is up in the high plains of Colorado helping a fellow bondman bring his most elusive fugitives to justice. When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What starts out as a perfect day for Dog turns ugly fast. He and Beth just bought bunnies for their kids, and Dog is enjoying helping them learn to care for their new pets. But duty calls and this is a tough case to fathom.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog thinks he's got an average day of bounty hunting ahead of him, but he couldn't be more wrong. Beth calls a client, Daphne, whose bond they have to revoke and makes a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team must deal with misleading informants, belligerent boaters, and angry drunks when they go after Kimberly, a traffic offender with over 20 violations. And if that isn't enough, Dog has another problem -- Duane Lee is sick.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There are few louder wake-up calls than coming-to in a jail cell with no idea how you got there. Add the media splashing the news of your arrest on every TV channel, and if your name is Lyssa Chapman you know you are in for a rough day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With Duane Lee back on the team, the rift in the Chapman clan appears over. But will time heal this wound or make it worse?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.desc: When an alleged abuser goes on the lame Dog gathers the team to bring him in. As the leads grow colder Dog's determination only grows stronger. Finally a hot lead comes in and Dog sets the trap for his prey.

programme.desc: When can a bounty hunt also be a date? When Dog and Beth decide to ride in the same SUV as they pursue a run away fugitive, will their different approaches to the investigation lead to a capture and romance?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.
